title: Goa Government's Education Website Sent Users To A Porn Site, And No One Knows Why

Goa Government's Education Website Sent Users To A Porn Site, And No One Knows Why

Goa Government's Education Website Sent Users To A Porn Site, And No One Knows Why

The official website for the Directorate of Education and Directorate of Official Language has been pulled down after the site was discovered redirecting its visitors to an external website that flashed pornographic content.

While the website opened fine upon entering the URL, the problem existed with what lied on the bottom of the webpage.

The website had a bottom ticker that displayed several 'Digitial India' initiatives like Aadhar, Digilocker etc. When users clicked on the Aadhaar image, the visitors were redirected to an entirely different website that displayed inappropriate and pornographic content.

Don't Miss 199 SHARES 8.4 K SHARES 15.3 K SHARES 7.1 K SHARES

The URL for which this specific link was aadharcarduidai.in, whereas the official Aadhar website URL is uidai.gov.in.

This odd occurrence was spotted by known security researcher 'Elliot Alderson'. He shared this discovery on Twitter, post which the websites were taken down. Even the misleading URL is now defunct.

⚠️ NSFW ⚠️

1. During an investigation I found the website https://t.co/DCTpwkh7jw. An #Aadhaar related website? Not at all! This is a porn website. — Elliot Alderson (@fs0c131y) October 23, 2019

What's odd is the fact that this link has been present on the official website of the Directorate of Education, Government of Goa for a while now. In fact, with the help of Wayback Machine, an internet archive, the link has been on it since February this year. How come no one spotted this and rectified it then?

The website for Goa government was completely revamped this year, with a ton of inclusion such as the Digital India ticker that was not present on the previous iteration of the website.

There is no official statement by the Goa government as of now. We also don't know by when would these sites be back online.

This year, the official website of BJP (Bhartiya Janta Party) website was also defaced by hackers, leaving behind a series of defamatory and insulting messages about PM Narendra Modi and his followers and supporters. The site was taken down then and launched back in a few days as if nothing happened.
